needs.description: IPC Phase 3 (Crisis) conditions persist in Garissa County, with 280,000 people facing acute food insecurity due to prolonged drought and below-average rainfall. Livestock deaths have reached 15% in pastoral areas, reducing household income and food access.

Acute malnutrition rates among children under 5 have risen to 18.5% GAM in Garissa, exceeding the 15% emergency threshold. Measles outbreaks reported in 3 sub-counties, with 420 confirmed cases since January 2026.
Only 38% of the population in Garissa has access to safe drinking water. Drought has dried up 65% of water pans and boreholes, forcing women and children to walk an average of 12 km daily for water.

needs.description: Mandera County faces IPC Phase 4 (Emergency) conditions, with 210,000 people experiencing severe food gaps. The 2025 Deyr rains failed completely, marking the fifth consecutive poor season.
Cross-border conflict with Somalia has displaced 45,000 people internally since October 2025. Dadaab refugee camp hosts 235,000 refugees, 60% of whom are children under 18.
Malnutrition admissions to stabilization centers increased by 42% in Q4 2025. Cholera cases reached 890 in Mandera town, with 12 deaths reported due to contaminated water sources.

needs.description: Turkana County remains in IPC Phase 3 (Crisis) with 380,000 people food insecure. Livestock body conditions are poor, with 28% of cattle and 35% of goats at risk of death without immediate intervention.
GAM prevalence stands at 21.3% in Turkana North sub-county, well above the 15% emergency threshold. Therapeutic feeding programs are treating 15,200 children monthly.
Water trucking costs have increased by 65% due to fuel prices, limiting access for 78% of the population. Only 22% of households have access to improved sanitation facilities.

needs.description: COVID-19 cases have resurged with 1,250 new infections reported in February 2026. ICU bed occupancy reached 78% in public hospitals, with oxygen shortages affecting 3 major facilities.
Flash floods in January 2026 destroyed 4,200 informal settlement homes in Kibera and Mathare, displacing 18,500 people. Emergency shelter kits are needed for 12,000 households.
Gender-based violence cases increased by 28% in informal settlements, with 890 reported incidents in January 2026. Only 3 functional GBV referral centers serve Nairobi's 4.3M population.

needs.description: Dengue fever outbreak continues with 3,200 confirmed cases since December 2025. Vector control efforts cover only 40% of high-risk areas due to funding constraints.
Only 65% of Mombasa's population has access to piped water, with intermittent supply affecting 280,000 residents. Open defecation remains prevalent in 12 informal settlements.
Flood damage to 28 schools in Changamwe and Kisauni sub-counties has disrupted learning for 14,500 students. Temporary learning spaces are needed while repairs are conducted.

needs.description: Rising food prices have pushed 65,000 people into IPC Phase 2 (Stressed) conditions. Maize prices increased by 28% compared to the five-year average, reducing household purchasing power.
Measles-Rubella vaccination coverage dropped to 78% in Uasin Gishu County, below the 95% target. 230 unvaccinated children identified in outreach activities.
Teacher strikes have disrupted schooling for 85,000 students in Uasin Gishu County. Learning hours reduced by 40% in affected schools since January 2026.
